article.title: Bundaberg_Rum
article.paragraph: Bundaberg Rumis a darkrumproduced inBundaberg, Australia. It is often referred to as "Bundy".The Bundaberg Distilling Company owns its owncola-producing facility, which supplies the cola for itsAlcopopready-to-drinkBundaberg Rum and Cola products.
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Bundaberg Rum originated because the local sugar mills had a problem with what to do with the wastemolassesafter the sugar was extracted (it was heavy, difficult to transport and the costs of converting it to stock feed were rarely worth the effort). Sugar men first began to think of the profits that could be made from distilling. The vital meeting was held at the Royal Hotel on 1 August 1885, W M C Hickson served as the chairman, and other notables in attendance included all the big sugar mill owners of that time, W G Farquhar, F L Nott, S McDougall, T Penny, S H Bravo and A H Young, all to become the first directors of the Company. They started with a capital ofpound sterling5,000.citationBundy A Centenary HistoryKeithDunstan
The Bundaberg Distilling Company began its operations in 1888.

Bundaberg rum was first produced in 1889, production ceased from 1907 to 1914 and from 1936 to 1939 after fires, the second of which caused rum from the factory to spill into the nearbyBurnett River.citationJuliaRobinsonVoices of Queensland: words from the sunshine stateOxford University Press2001

H T Christsen Pty Ltd operated their own Bundaberg Rum bottling plant in Bourbong Street, Bundaberg at the rear of their large grocery and hardware business in the centre of town. The spirit was sold at UP and OP strength from their business. Spokesperson for the original family, Mr Rod Patch, recalls the origins of the shape of the current "Bundy Bottle". It originated from the Bushells Coffee Chicory bottle that Bundaberg folks sold to his grandfather at the firm for one penny a bottle, after which they were washed and filled with the famous spirit. The shape remains the same but the capacity has been increased to the current 700ml. Patch's great grandfather, Hans Truval Christsen, a Danish immigrant from Copenhagen and his son Frederick Christsen had an employment policy of employing staff from the Salvation Army faith in the rum bottling process as they were less likely to be tempted to sample the spirit. The Christsen family supported settlement farming families through hard times and these good deeds were acknowledged with the naming of Christsen Park at Bargara Beach.

In 1961, the company introduced thepolar bearas its unusual choice of mascot, to imply that the rum could ward off the coldest chill.cite webhttp://www.bundabergrum.com.au/explore/distillery/chapter/03Bundaberg Rum website â€“ history section26 March 2008Bundaberg Rum website

In 2000, the Bundaberg Rum company andDistillationdistillerywere sold to British companyDiageo.cite press releasehttp://www.just-drinks.com/news/diageo-acquires-bundaberg-rum-from-bundaberg-sugar-group-ltd_id78650.aspxDiageo acquires Bundaberg Rum from Bundaberg Sugar Group LtdDiageo PLCJust-Drinkshttp://web.archive.org/web/20140213221626/http://www.just-drinks.com/news/diageo-acquires-bundaberg-rum-from-bundaberg-sugar-group-ltd_id78650.aspx13 February 20146 December 2000

In 2014, A decision by Diageo to relocate the bottling operations of Queensland's iconic drink, "Bundaberg Rum", to the western Sydney suburb ofHuntingwood, New South WalesHuntingwoodresulted in local job losses in the city that bears its name. The decision drew criticism from all levels of Queensland politics:

list.listitem: Premier Campbell Newman said it was a disappointing move, particularly in a region that had suffered devastating floods in recent years.cite newshttp://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/queensland/workers-sacked-as-bundaberg-rum-bottling-moves-to-sydney-20140517-38glq.htmlWorkers sacked as Bundaberg Rum bottling moves to SydneyCameronAtfield18 May 2014Brisbane TimesFairfax Mediahttp://web.archive.org/web/20140607175745/http://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/queensland/workers-sacked-as-bundaberg-rum-bottling-moves-to-sydney-20140517-38glq.html7 June 2014
Bundaberg mayor Mal Forman said "I'm saddened by the announcement, but I had been assured the company had a commitment to the city".
Cr Forman said "I understood demand for bottled Bundaberg Rum had declined as more people bought pre-mixed cans, a trend I wanted no part of".

article.paragraph: Later a Diageo spokeswoman clarified by saying "Some premium products, such as the Master Distillers Collection, would continue to be bottled in Bundaberg. This was not a decision we have taken lightly, however it is a necessary one to ensure the longer term sustainability of the distillery. We remain absolutely committed to Bundaberg and the distillery and will continue to invest and focus on our core business of distilling, maturing and blending great quality rum in Bundaberg as we have done for the last 125 years."cite newshttp://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2014/05/16/4005996.htmAustralian Broadcasting Commission16 May 2014RossKayKalleeBuchananSydney Rum? article.heading: Distillery
article.paragraph: File:Rum-4-Large.jpgthumbVisitors Centre & '''Big Bundy Bottle'''The Bundaberg Rum distillery is open to visitors for tours of the facility. There is also a museum which offers free samples of Bundaberg Rum products for visitors in a historic Queenslander house. TheBig Bundy Bottleis also outside of the bondstore.

article.heading: Sponsorship
article.paragraph: Bundaberg Rum is a major sponsor of the AustralianAustralia national rugby union teamWallabiesrugby unionteam and also sponsors the Bundaberg Rum Rugby Series. Bundaberg is also a sponsor of theNew South Wales WaratahsNSW Waratahs.citationhttp://web.archive.org/web/20090124091032/http://nswrugby.com.au/SponsorsPartners/SponsorsPartnersOverview.aspx24 January 2009http://nswrugby.com.au/SponsorsPartners/SponsorsPartnersOverview.aspxSponsors & PartnersNSW RugbyBundaberg Rum sponsored the rugby leagueANZAC Testtill 2009. Bundaberg Rum signed a 5-year deal with theNational Rugby LeagueNRLto be the official dark rum of the NRL. They are also the naming-rights sponsor of NRL Friday Night Football.
article.heading: Recognitions
article.paragraph: Bundaberg Rum has been distinguished with numerous awards. In 2011, Bundaberg Rum's Master Distillers' Collective rum was launched, with the first three releases, the 10 Year Old, Port Barrel and Golden Reserve, winning awards in the global stage.cite webDistillery Profile: Bundaberg Rumhttp://australianbartender.com.au/2012/11/29/distillery-profile-bundaberg-rum/Australian Bartender21 October 2013cite webMikeKnottJudges wowed by Bundy Rumhttp://www.news-mail.com.au/news/judges-wowed-by-bundy-rum/1079828/NewsMail21 October 2013
article.heading: Advertising
article.paragraph: Bundaberg Rum has also been criticised for targeting its advertising towards young people and boys, through television commercials duringNational Rugby LeagueNRLbroadcasts, and other promotions.citationhttp://www.abc.net.au/rn/talks/bbing/stories/s720116.htmhttps://web.archive.org/web/20090331110022/http://www.abc.net.au/rn/talks/bbing/stories/s720116.htm31 March 2009Australian Broadcasting CommissionABC Radio National3 November 2002Teenage Boyscitationhttp://www.caan.adf.org.au/newsletter.asp?ContentIdhttp://web.archive.org/web/20060820084415/http://www.caan.adf.org.au/newsletter.asp?ContentIdBundaberg Rum Marketing Challenged in WACommunity Alcohol Action Network (CAAN)Grogwatch20 August 200612 June 2006A series of advertisements featuring the Bundaberg Rum bear, apolar bearknown as Bundy R. Bear, were produced by advertising agencyLeo Burnett WorldwideLeo Burnettto align the product 'with a larrikin approach to Australian mateship'.cite webMacleodDuncanBundy Bear - Bundaberg Rum Mascothttp://theinspirationroom.com/daily/2006/bundaberg-rum-bundy-bear/The Inspiration Room12 April 201519 August 2006Bundaberg Rum, a product of Queensland, Australia, has a polar bear for a mascot, Bundy R. Bear. Bundy has starred in a number of television advertisementsThe Bundaberg Rum bear first appeared in 1961. It was designed to soften rum's aggressive image and broaden its appeal from the traditional older male drinker to a more sociable audience.cite webMcMahonBrett50th Birthday of Bundy R. Bearhttp://www.bundabergrumshowcase.com.au/1961speech.htmlbundabergrumshowcase.com.au12 April 2015The advertisements have been cited as a favourite among Australia's youth.citationhttp://www.bandt.com.au/news/archive/young-adults-are-a-paradox-for-marketersYoung adults are a paradox for marketers20 December 2004B&TCamilleAlarconhttp://web.archive.org/web/20120331161217/http://www.bandt.com.au/news/archive/young-adults-are-a-paradox-for-marketers31 March 2012
